title: @riot why is ekko getting another skin so soon
body: New skin on pbe, but he got his last skin 2 months ago. Reasoning?

replies.body:
Yo Ecodeath!

So yes, ever since we moved from two lower scope launch skins per champion to one higher scope skin we have waited a bit to release new skins for new champs. In this situation our decision making was two fold: first off we loved this theme for Ekko and we didn't want his newness to keep the skin from being made, and secondly this is kind of a test for us. Do you guys like getting a new skin for a new champ sooner than later? We want your feedback! 

I'm not saying that this is going to be something that happens normally now, but it is a test case for us. So yeah if the community hates it, or loves it we want to hear your opinions.

My general reaction was 'Ekko gets another skin already? It took over a year for Diana/Lissandra/so many others to get their second skin since they decided to release only one skin on release, and Ekko gets his in two months. There had better be a good Diana/Liss skin in the works, Riot!'

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=JsAE83Bg,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2015-08-05T17:58:51.781+0000)

So, we have tons of skins in various stages of production at all times. I can't speak on what skins are currently slotted but there any many and many of them are for champions who are in desperate need of a new skin. 

We try and cover champions as evenly as possible in terms of skin cadence, but you have to understand that as the amount of champions total increases the time between each champions new skin will go up as well, this isn't a 50 champion game any more. I do agree that this should give us more incentive to prioritize champions who need some skin love.

As skins has communicated in the past unexpected issues, VU blockers, and in game events can also extend the times between champion skins.

I love idea to prioritize champions who have gone a long time without a skin (ignoring bot champions who are undergoing VU like Poppy/Taric, and "skins" that come from the winning team at Worlds) should be at worst number two deciding factor. Nothing worse than seeing a champion passed over who went a LONG time without a skin (Zac/Zed/Shen/Fiora [who didn't need a VU at all compared to the other old champions]), in favour of a new champion. I can see that causing a lot of friction with the player base. (Chromas should never be used as an example of a champion getting a new "skin" either)

'Time between each champions new skin will go up as well.' Unless you're Ekko!

I understand that you have 120ish champions to deal with, considering there are roughly 6 or so that aren't getting any skins in the foreseeable future because their rigs suck. I understand that these are relatively quick 750 skins; making Academy Ekko and Academy Ahri probably didn't take all that long as compared to a 975+ skin. I understand that I really shouldn't be getting annoyed that Ekko is getting a skin so soon; it should be a good thing!

But then I look at the terrible face on Lunar Goddess Diana, Dark Valkyrie Diana losing her headgear because people are stupid, and Lissandra's terrible skins, and I just get kinda upset.

As someone who owns nearly 400 skins, I do have a few words on this.

1.  Some champs have waited over four years for new skins (Yorick, Kassadin, Sion and Taric), yet Ekko gets one announced two months after release?  Seems suspect at the very least, especially considering that this tier is regarded as the lowest in quality.
2.  The other champs in the "Academy" line aren't starved for skin love, are they?  Darius and Vladimir already have legendary level skins and their last ones were released less than a year ago.  Ahri's going to be on her 7th skin (including Classic) and she already had a skin released this year!
3.  With these skins, it seems that Riot's only interested in creating skins for popular champions (thus justifying their salaries as players make RP purchases) more than delivering high quality skins for champions that haven't been touched in years.  (Blood Moon Zilean, King of Clubs Mordekaiser and Safecracker Eve being the worst examples of this.)  I'm sure this isn't true, but in a year when a champion sees their 10th skin (Annie) released without apology, it doesn't feel false.

I'm all for allowing every department within Riot the freedom to release content as they want to, but I would hope that the focus is more towards correcting and filling their backlog of unloved champs.

I can't help but feel like this was an excuse made off the bat. That this was never your intentions at all, but you're covering it up. "Ekko got a huge set of buffs, everyone's definitely going to want to play him more now! LET'S GIVE HIM A NEW SKIN TO PROFIT!"
